### Crispin’s Current Challenges

- Revenue dropped from $40M to $26M (likely closer to $30-32M due to poor scoping)
- Staffed like a $48M agency - “bloated in the wrong ways”
- Major talent issues across account and strategy fronts
  - Inexperienced staff promoted beyond capabilities
  - Junior staff getting burned out on mismatched roles (brand designers forced into production work)
  - Fundamental misalignment of values and skills
- Scopes weren’t renewed heading into 2026
  - DSW contract reality: $2M once every three years, not annually
  - Natural business shrinkage in certain industries

### Growth Team Problems

- Biggest operational issue is their growth function
- CMO Stephen Bonsignore: WPP PR background, smart but “doesn’t know what he doesn’t know”
- Current new business lead (Caitlin): MMI influencer team background
  - Goes to Disneyland monthly with husband
  - Doesn’t understand larger revenue model or business fundamentals
  - Can’t differentiate between profitable vs. unprofitable opportunities
- Growth team chasing wrong opportunities
  - Example: $100K garage door opener company requiring $300K in staffing
  - Taking ten $100K clients instead of one $1M client
- No one tracking organic growth or new business growth against actual capacity

### Systems and Operational Issues

- Selling 10 products on paper when should focus on 3
- No clear job descriptions across performance, brand, and social marketing
- RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) plans missing
- MMI folks operate on flat fee model - “say yes to everything, someone just does it”
- RFP evaluation problems:
  - Not assessing if RFP aligns with offering and reputation goals
  - Poor understanding of staffing requirements vs. revenue
  - Scoping without understanding different role capabilities

### Leadership and Reporting Structure

- Maggie hired friends who all report directly to her, bypassing Kim’s authority
- Michael Diacino (CFO): Legacy MMI, sees problems but doesn’t know solutions
- Stagwell now stepping in to babysit due to poor performance
- Joanna handling both strategy and inherited account services
- Head of strategy (Juliana) overextended, hired freelancer for strategy work

### What Quality Growth Person Needs

- Strategic understanding of Crispin’s unique differentiators
- Partnership skills with consultants on premium packaging
- Relationship building and cold calling capabilities
- Understanding of agency profitability models
- Entrepreneurial mindset to “help make this work”
- NYC-caliber hustle and sophistication (not Houston-based)
- Critical evaluation skills for opportunity assessment

### Next Steps and Action Items

- Kim will send positioning PDF by 12:30 PM her time today
- Sam to create job description with value explanation in short paragraphs
- Document to be sent back to Kim, Maggie, COO, and Joanna for alignment
- Focus brief around moving from “king of 300 shitty brands to king of 3 pretty cool brands”
- Structure as one-pager with:
  - State of industry
  - Understanding of business from outside perspective
  - Immediate vs. long-term goals
  - How challenger role achieves both
